comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Four A3D-2/A-3B Skywarrior in formation flypast over CVA-60 USS Saratoga that may have made a full turn from the curved wake. VAH-9 'Hoot Owls'. Tail code AC of Carrier Air Group/Wing Three (CVG-3/CVW-3) www.gonavy.jp/CVG-CVG3f.html www.gonavy.jp/CVW-ACf.html VAH-9 'Hoot Owls' went aboard CVA-60 for successive sailings between 1958 & 1963 A trio of VAH-9 A3D-2 in same markings as in ‘flickr’pic: a3skywarrior.com/index.php?nid=101894&s=gl&media_... A singleton VAH-9 A3D-2 in same markings as in ‘flickr’pic: a3skywarrior.com/index.php?nid=101894&s=gl&media_... A slightly similar VAH-9 flypast over CVA-60 in 1963: a3skywarrior.com/index.php?nid=101894&s=gl&media_... The tail ends of two VAH-9 A3D-2/A-3B on board the carrier: a3skywarrior.com/index.php?nid=101896&s=gl&media_... An A3D-2 138955 of VAH-9 'stumbling' aboard CVA-60 USS Saratoga 1959/1960: commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:A3D-2_nose_wheel_collapse...
